TITLE: How a faulty CrowdStrike update crashed computers around the world
DESCRIPTION: All it took was one faulty CrowdStrike software update to cause global disruptions on July 19 that grounded flights, knocked banks and media outlets offline, and disrupted hospitals, retailers and other services. Read full story

DESCRIPTION: China's airlines and banks were not impacted by the tech glitch, and operations at Beijing's airports remained normal, according to Chinese state media.

TITLE: Microsoft says about 8.5 million of its devices affected by CrowdStrike-related outage
DESCRIPTION: (Reuters): A global tech outage that was related to a software update by cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike affected nearly 8.5 million Microsoft devices, Microsoft said in a blog post on Saturday. “We currently estimate that CrowdStrike’s update affected 8.5 million Windows devices, or less than one percent of all Windows machines,” it said in the blog.
